column3: Countries (Please name the countries that will be involved in this pilot)

column10: Description
column12: Parameters to be recorded

column10: Three weather stations (one per piloting site) with a rain sensor, to detect rainfall, anemometer to measure wind speed and direction, air temperature sensor, air humidity sensor, barometer to monitor atmospheric pressure. The basic equipment can be supplemented with sensors for UV and solar radiation.
column11: Vantage Pro 2 weather stations - Davis Instruments Corp., Hayward, CA, United States
column12: Rainfall, wind speed and direction, air temperature, relative humidity, baromentric pressure, solar radiation

column10: Six soil moisture sensors recording the humidity and temperature of the soil, two per weather station in 30 and 50 cm depth.
column11: Decagon EC-5 - METER Group, Inc., Pullman, WA, USA
column12: Soil humidity and temperature

column10: uRADMonitor model A3 uses the Bosch BME280 to measure air temperature, barometric pressure, humidity and humidity. A MOX VOC sensor measures volatile organic compounds. A high quality laser scattering sensor is used to detect the Particulate Matter PM2.5 concentration in air. There are two electrochemical sensors, one for formaldehyde sensor and another one for ozone and a nondispersive infrared sensor for CO2. A built in fan assures an active air flow stream across the sensing elements. There is also a noise level sensor.
column12: Air temperature, Air humidity, Barometric Pressure, VOC, Formaldehyde, Ozone, PM1, PM2.5, PM10, CO2
NH3, CH4, wind speed and direction

column10:
FTIR spectral data will be collected  using a ZnSe 45° HATR
(Horizontal Attenuated Total Reflectance) crystal and an FTIR-6200 JASCO spectrometer equipped with a standard sample chamber, a triglycine sulphate (TGS) detector and a Ge/KBr beamsplitter. The crystal wiil be used has a refractive index of 2.4 and a depth of penetration of 2.0 μm at 1000 cmˉ¹. Using the Spectra Manager™ Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) software version 2, spectra will be collected  by accumulating 100 scans with a resolution of 4 cmˉ¹ and a total integration time of 2 min.  A small portion from the sample will be transferred to the crystal plate, covered with a small piece of aluminum foil, and then pressed with a gripper to ensure the best possible contact with the crystal.
column12: Spectral range of 4000 – 400 cmˉ¹ /  fingerprints from foods across the manufacturing production

column10: The electronic nose system (FOX 3000, Alpha MOS, Toulouse, France) is equipped with 12 metal oxide gas sensors (MOS sensors) based on different sensing materials. Gas sensors are located in two temperature controlled chambers within high temperature and zero humidity and a purified air generator is used to provide carrier gas for cleaning sensors. The sensors array comprised of LY, P and T type sensors. Sensor response is recorded by Alpha Soft v.12 software (Alpha MOS, Toulouse, France). The sampling conditions (quantity, volume, temperature and headspace generating time) are optimized previously in order to decide the optimum conditions and improve sensor performance.
column12: Response of each sensor (electrical signal) to the odorants (volatile compounds) collected from the headspace of each sample

column10: The Freshdetect BFD-100 emits 400mW optical radiation at a wavelength of 405nm. The device is portable, powered by a rechangable battery and operated by hand. (The BFD-100 is designed to measure the total plate count of meat and must be placed directly on the sample.)
column12: For each sample intensity in the range 458-899nm is acquired.

column10: Multispectral images will be acquired in 18 different, non-uniformly distributed wavelengths ranging from UV (405 nm) to short wave NIR (970 nm). Briefly, the procedure for image acquisition and segmentation will be described, the system will be subjected to a light set up procedure known as “autolight” and will be calibrated radiometrically and geometrically. The samples will be transferred to Petri dishes, will be placed inside the Ulbricht sphere and multispectral images of the samples’ surface will be acquired. In order for redundant information (related to the background, fat, and not to the sample) to be removed image segmentation will be performed using the VideometerLab system software (version 2.12.39). The contrast between the sample material and the other irrelevant objects is maximized, in order to enable a threshold operation. Then, canonical discriminant analysis is employed, resulting in the production of a segmented image.
column12: The mean reflectance within the informative area (i.e., mean intensity of pixels) along with the corresponding standard deviation is calculated for each wavelength (405, 435, 450,470, 505, 525, 570, 590, 630, 645, 660, 700, 850, 870, 890, 910, 940, 970nm).

column10: NIR spectra will be collected using a portable NIR spectrometer in the range [900nm, 1700nm]. The sensor NIRvascan ASP-NIR-M T (Allied Scientific Pro) sensor, employs a 1 mm InGaAs datector (Hamamatsu model G12180-010A) Dark Current 0.8nA @VR=1V Noise Equivalent Power 1.4*10-14 @λp	It is controlled by ISC-NIRScan Software under Windows OS (usb connection) or with an app (ios and adroid, using bluetooth connection). NIR measurements will be collected directly, taking a portion of the sample and placing into the cuvette in the spectral range of 900–1700 nm, by accumulating 10 internal scans.
column12: Ιn total 353 linearly distributed measurements in the range [900-1700] will be acquired for each sample.

column10: Metabolic profiles of the organic acids, off-odor, as well as other metabolic compounds or substrates (e.g. glucose, etc) of foods can be determined by HPLC. The HPLC system consists of a JASCO LC-Net II/ADC system controller, a JASCO AS-2055 Plus Autosampler with a Model PU-980 Intelligent pump, a Model LG-980-02 ternary gradient unit pump and different types of detectors (e.g. MD-910 multiwavelength detector), while the appropriate type of column is used for the determination of different metabolites/compounds. The software used for spectra collection and processing is Jasco Chrompass Chromatography Data system v1.7.403.1.
column12: Metabolic end-products or food compounds (low molecular compounds) / oxidized during storage of food system

column10: Mesure temperature and humidity of plant production
column12: Air temperature, Air humidity,

column10: Mesure temperature and humidity of plant production
column12: Air temperature, Air humidity,

column1: P2 and  P3  (fermented products mainly) & fish products
column10: Dosage of biogenic amines (histamine)
column12: Quantity (mg/kg)*

column10: The concentrations of Acrylamide in infant food samples will be estimated using a Waters Xevo TQ-S LC-MS/MS intrument. The method is accredited.
column11: Waters Xevo TQS, Acquity I UPLC
column12: Acrylamide amount in infant food

column10: The concentrations of the eleven regulated mycotoxins (Aflatoxins B1, B2,G1,G2, Ochratoxin A, Deoxynivalenone, Zearolenone, Fumonisins B1, B2, T2 and HT-2 toxins) will be dermined in maize samples using a Waters Xevo TQ-S LC-MS/MS intrumentation. The method is accredited.
column11: Waters Xevo TQS, Acquity I UPLC
column12: 11 Mycotoxins in cereals and raw materials to be used for the preparation of infant food. The method is not accredited for infant food and no data are available.

column10: The amount/concentrations of heavy metals and other chemical elements (Pb, Cd, Hg, tot As, Al, Cr, Mn, Fe, Co, Cu, Ni, Zn, Se, Sn) in poutlry muscle samples will be calculated using a Thermo iCAP QC ICP-MS. The method is accredited.
column12: Concentration of 14 chemical elements and heavy metals in poultry met samples.

column10: The amount/concentrations of heavy metals and other chemical elements (Pb, Cd, Hg, tot As, Al, Cr, Mn, Fe, Co, Cu, Ni, Zn, Se, Sn) in cattle muscle samples will be calculated using a Thermo iCAP QC ICP-MS. The method is accredited.
column12: Concentration of 14 chemical elements and heavy metals in cattle meat samples.

column10: The amount/concentrations of heavy metals and other chemical elements (Pb, Cd, Hg, tot As, Al, Cr, Mn, Fe, Co, Cu, Ni, Zn, Se, Sn) in fish samples (fresh and frozen fish, fresh and frozen moluscs) will be calculated using a Thermo iCAP QC ICP-MS. The method is accredited.
column12: Concentration of 14 chemical elements and heavy metals in fish tissue samples.

column10: The presence of antibiotics, nitrofuran metabolites, chloramphenicol, thiamphenicol, dapsone, NSAID's, Anabolic steroids and Corticosteroids, and their concentrations in the contaminated poultry muscle samples will be determined using LC-MS/MS, LC-QTOF and HPLC-FLD techiques.
column12: Concentration of 183 veterinary drugs in poultry meat samples.

column10: The presence of antibiotics, nitrofuran metabolites, chloramphenicol, thiamphenicol, abamectins, NSAID's, Anabolic steroids and Corticosteroids, and their concentrations in the contaminated cattle muscle samples will be determined using LC-MS/MS, LC-QTOF and HPLC-FLD techiques.
column12: Concentration of 183 veterinary drugs in cattle meat samples.

column10: The presence of antibiotics and dyes and the concentrations of contaminaed fish samples will be determined using LC-MS/MS, LC-QTOF and HPLC-FLD techiques.
column12: Concentration of 80 antibiotics and 5 dyes in fish meat tissue samples.

column10: The wireless, smart sensors transmit crop quality data while submerged in the grain bulk. Sensors transmit O2, CO2, Temperature, Rel. Hum., and PH3 measurements to a Gateway, which uploads the data to Centaur’s Internet of Crops Platform to the cloud.
column12: O2, CO2, Temperature, Relative Humidity, Phosphine (PH3)

column10:
Detection of microbiological hazards (Salmonella spp., Listeria monocytogenes), or hygiene indicators (E. coli).  AOAC Performance Tested MethodSM License Nr. 122002,
validated on stainless steel, ceramic and plastic surfaces (Listeria monocytogenes only). N-LightTM Salmonella spp. and E. coli test kits will not be available until end of Q2 2021.

column10: FTIR / ATR spectra will be collected using a ZnSe/AMTIR 45° attenuated total reflectance flat plate crystal on a Perkin Elmer Frontier FTIR spectrometer is equipped with DLaTGS detector with a KBr window. The spectrometer is equipped with software PerkinElmer Spectrum v10.4.2 to collect spectra over the wavelength range of 4,000 to 650/870 cm-1 (depending on the plate crystal) from the sample surface at 25°C.
column12: spectra (spectra range of 4,000 to 650/870 cm-1)  / fingerprints of baby foods

column10: FTIR / ATR spectra will be collected using a ZnSe/AMTIR 45° attenuated total reflectance flat plate crystal on a Perkin Elmer Frontier FTIR spectrometer is equipped with DLaTGS detector with a KBr window. The spectrometer is equipped with software PerkinElmer Spectrum v10.4.2 to collect spectra over the wavelength range of 4,000 to 650/870 cm-1 (depending on the plate  crystal) from the sample surface at 25°C.
column12: spectra (spectra range of 4,000 to 650/870 cm-1)  / fingerprints of chicken meat samples

column10: FTIR / ATR spectra will be collected using a ZnSe/AMTIR 45° attenuated total reflectance flat plate crystal on a Perkin Elmer Frontier FTIR spectrometer is equipped with DLaTGS detector with a KBr window. The spectrometer is equipped with software PerkinElmer Spectrum v10.4.2 to collect spectra over the wavelength range of 4,000 to 650/870 cm-1 (depending on the plate  crystal) from the sample surface at 25°C.
column12: spectra (spectra range of 4,000 to 650/870 cm-1)  / fingerprints of chicken meat samples

column10: Spoilage associated bacteria can be  detected using Raman spectra.  Raman spectra will be collected with a BW&TEC portable Raman machine (Raman Pro, B&WTek, LLC, USA) which is equipped with a diode laser operating at 785 nm. Samples is measured for 20 s (10 s exposure time × 2 exposures) at 100 mW laser power. Each steak will be scanned on the new cut surface and perpendicular to the muscle fiber eight times. Raman shift is recorded from 239 - 3231 cm-1.
column12: Raman spectra

column10: Organic acid can be analyzed by HPLC (Shimadzu LC-2030 C Prominence-i (Japan) system equipped with a quaternary low-pressure gradient Solvent Delivery LC-2030 pump with high-pressure switching valves, online LC-2030 degasser unit, a high sensitivity LC-2030 ultraviolet (UV)-detector). A separation is carried out in Kinetex XB-C18 column (100 Aº, 250 mm × 4.6 mm, 5 μm pore size).
column12: spectra images of organic acid

column10: The TVBN content can be determined by FT-NIR. The NIR spectra will be collected in the reflectance mode using the Antaris II FT-NIR spectrophotometer (Thermo Electron Co., USA) equipped with a NIR fibre-optic probe.Each spectrum is the average of 32 scans. The spectral range is 10,000– 4000 cm1 and each spectrum is measured according to 3.856 cm1 data interval, and thus, each spectrum has 1557 data points (i.e., spectral variables).
column12: NIR spectra

column10:
Heavy metals in samples can be detected by Atomic Absorption Spectrophotmeter (AA-6800, Shimadzu Corp,Kyoto, Japan) equipped with a deuterium background corrector, a 6500-electrothermal atomizer and an ASC-6100 autosampler. Wall atomization  with standard high-density graphite tubes  (Shimadzu-Tokio-Japan) was used.  Cobalt hollowcathode
lamp (Hamamatsu Photonics K.K., Japan)
is employed as radiation source.
column12: Heavy metals

column10: Gas composition (% O2 and %CO2)  inside packages can be monitored by gas analyzer(Check-Point O2/CO2; PBI-Dansensor A/S, Ringsted, Denmark). The instrument needle will be inserted through a rubber septum attached to the covered material.
column11: Check-Point O2/CO2; PBI-Dansensor A/S, Ringsted, Denmark)
column12: Oxygen and carbon dioxide concentrations inside packages

column10: Volatile compounds can be analyzed by GC-MS (TQ8030, Shimadzu Corp,Kyoto, Japan) using HP-5MS capillary column (30 m × 0.25 mm × 0.25 μm,122 Agilent)
column12: Volatile compounds during storage of food system

column10: FTIR-ATR measurements will be collected directly from the sample surface at 20 °C in the spectral range of 4000–400 cm-1, by accumulating 100 scans with a resolusion of 0.09 cm-1
column12: Spectra (spectral range of 4000–400 cm-1) /  fngerprints from feed and foods

column10: Molecular interation in food based materials.

column10: The hand hold three-dimensional laser scanner uses multiple line beam lasers to obtain the 3D point cloud on the surface of the object. The operator holds the scanner and adjusts the distance and angle between the scanner and the measured object in real time, and the system automatically obtains the 3D surface of the measured object. information. The scanner can perform efficient and accurate scanning according to the size, shape and working environment of the scanned object.
column12: Three-dimensional coordinates

column10: Multispectral images are acquired using MS camera (MQ022MG-CM, XIMEA, Munster, Germany) with a 16 mm fixed focus lens and a resolution of 409*216 pixels, which can be mounted on unmanned aerial vehicle. MS camera can provide accurate 25-band spectral data ranging from 600 to 875 nm for agricultural remote sensing.

column10: The instruments mainly consists of an ImSpector N17E-QE imaging spectrograph (Specim, Oulu, Finland), two 150-W halogen lamps (Fiber-Lite DC9500 Illuminator; Dolan Jenner Industries Inc., USA), a CCD camera (Xeva 992; Xenices Infrared Solutions, Leuven, Belgium) coupled with a C-mount imaging lens (OLES22; Specim), a displacement platform driven by a stepper motor (Isuzu Optics Corp., Zhubei, Taiwan) to move the samples, and a computer. The hyperspectral imaging system acquires spectra in the form of pixels from the range of 874–1734 nm with a spectral resolution of 5 nm intervals. Each raw hyperspectral image of a sample contained 256 contiguous wavelength bands and 256 congruent sub-images.
column11: N17E-QE imaging spectrograph,  Specim, Oulu, Finland
column12: Hyperspectral images

column10: FC-500 Flow cytometer(BECKMAN COULTER) equiped with single laser light source of 488 nm, which can simultaneously excite 5 colors of fluorescence. The second laser of 633 nm HeNe laser is also provided to be choose. The sample detection sensitivity FITC is less than 100 MESF. The spectral detection range of the photomultiplier tube is 185-1000 nm. The particle sizes of detectable particles range from 0.2 to 50 μm.
column12: cell type and cell number

column10: The THz-TDS spectrometer system.  5 cm × 5 cm reflection imaging panel for THz-TDS system was covered with 0.1 mm-thick polyethylene film. The photoexcited terahertz radiation was emitted in 100 fs pulses to enable the instrument to output reliable photoelectric signals of absorption in the 0.1-5 THz.

column10: A Jasco FT/IR-4100 spectrometer (Japan) coupled with an upward looking diffuse reflectance accessory (UpIR) (PIKE Technologies, USA) was used to acquire the diffuse reflectance spectroscopy of a sample. The scanning range was from 7500 to 400 cm-1. The sample was placed into a ZnSe windowed sampling cup at the top of UpIR. Each sample was scanned 30 times, and then the averaged spectrum was used for analysis. This rapid scan system could perform up to 10 scans per second with high intensity ceramic light source and 45  Michelson interferometer. The S/N ratio was 22,000:1, wave-number accuracy was within ±0.01 cm 1, and the resolution was set as the max resolution of 0.9 cm 1. The Jasco spectra manager software was used for spectral measurement and analysis.
column12: spectra transmittance
